title: How to crack the PMP exam in two months - Quora

response.answer_text: Start self studying- Read Rita Mulcahy’s PMP Exam Prep and Andy Crowe’s The PMP Exam: How to Pass on Your First Try. Study for 2 hours every day (even weekends) Take practice exams to check your progress. You should already have been approved to take the exam Timing of the exam- Schedule to take the exam in two months. It will make you commit to studying Bootcamp- Take a PMP bootcamp for a week. Sacrifice your vacation time to take a bootcamp. It’s helpful if you already have the foundations of the exam. That way they can help reinforce what you need to learn and help with any tips. Really get your ITTOs (Input, Tools & Technology, Outputs) and formulas down. The PMP Notebook will help you with that. Saturday after your bootcamp, should be the day you take the test.

As a project manager, one of your duties is to be able to act as an intermediary between management and your project team to ensure cost, schedule and performance constraints are reasonable for the effort. Applying that same approach to yourself, you need to ask yourself why two months is the timeline for preparing for the PMP? You’ll need to take into account how much knowledge you already have over the subject matter, how much time you really have to study during those two months, and make a decision on whether a two month schedule is a reasonable period. Have you already taken the required coursework to qualify for the exam?
